title: Dear Abby: Paying grandma for child care becomes divorce war weapon
text: Dear Abby: Paying grandma for child care becomes divorce war weapon Friday, 23 October 2015 (2 minutes ago) Paying grandma for child care becomes divorce war weapon Whenever discussions about money occur, the ex-husband repeatedly tells my daughter he thinks it’s “offensive” that a grandparent charges money to watch the grandchildren. How do I tell him I think he’s out of line for making me feel bad for requesting the money? Stunned and Hurt in Tempe, Ariz. If he raises the subject of being “offended” with you, remind him in plain English that you are on a limited income, food is expensive and if the money weren’t needed you wouldn’t ask for it. Dear Executive Assistant: I’m sorry about the death of your former employer, but your lack of a letter of reference should not have prevented you from finding another job. [...] it might be regarded as a signal that you are not happy with your job. [...] because of fear of litigation, many employers today are reluctant to give out any information about an employee other than the length of time the person worked for the company.
